Setting.Name: Number of partitions for k-fold cross-validation test

Comment.Text: Overview This scenario should be used to train the LDA classifier used to detect opening/closing hand movements Just configure the Generic Stream Reader box to point to the last file you recorded with scenario 1-acquisition or 4-online and fast forward this scenario. At the end of the training, you will have an estimation of the classifier performance printed in the console. If this performance is lower than 65%, just run a new 1-acquisition session to have better results.

Then comes the feature extraction part. The signal is filtered in a large mu/beta [8 30] Hz range. Then the Stimulation Based Epoching box is used to select four seconds of signal half a second after the instruction was shown to the user (OVTK_StimulationId_Label_01 and OVTK_StimulationId_Label_02). The signal is then splitted in blocks of 1 second every 16th second and the logarithmic band power is computed thanks to the two Simple DSP and the Signal Average boxes. The matrices can then be converted in feature vectors. note: depending on what frequency range reacts best for the subject, you may have to tune this part of the scenario

The Classifier Trainer box produces a configuration file at the end of the experiment which will be used during online sessions. When the training is completed the box outputs a stimulation OVTK_StimulationId_TrainCompleted to stop the scenario through a Player Controller
The CSP spatial filter produced in the previous scenario is used prior to the feature extraction.
